text: Apionichthys nattereri is a species of sole in the family Achiridae. It was described by Franz Steindachner in 1876, originally under the genus Solea. It inhabits the Amazon River. It reaches a maximum standard length of . Due to a lack of known major threats to the species, A. nattereri is currently ranked as Least Concern by the IUCN redlist.Apionichthys nattereri at the IUCN redlist. ==References== Category:Pleuronectiformes Category:Fish described in 1876
title: Apionichthys nattereri
